abstract: Board of American Psychological Assn announces that three top officials, including chief executive Norman Anderson, will leave the group; shake-up comes days after report found that top officials in the group colluded with officials in Pres George W Bush's administration in approving CIA's use of harsh interrogation techniques that included torture.
lead_paragraph: The American Psychological Association announced a management shakeup on Tuesday, after a report of collusion between the group and the government.

headline.main: 3 Leave Jobs Over Psychologists’ Involvement in Terrorism Interrogations

snippet: The American Psychological Association announced a management shakeup on Tuesday, after a report of collusion between the group and the government.
